meanings.definition: To steer or guide a vehicle or vessel in a better or more skillful manner than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She outsteered the other driver to win the race.
meanings.sent2: The experienced captain outsteered the storm to keep the ship safe.
meanings.sent3: The clever squirrel outsteered the cat by climbing up the tree.
meanings.sent4: He outsteered his fears and sailed into the unknown.
meanings.sent5: The skilled pilot outsteered the turbulence with ease.

meanings.definition: To surpass or outdo in steering or guiding.
meanings.sent1: The young athlete outsteered his coach in the obstacle course.
meanings.sent2: She outsteered her competitors in the navigation challenge.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy outsteered the owner during the walk.
meanings.sent4: He outsteered his rival in the chess match with a brilliant move.
meanings.sent5: The talented dancer outsteered her partner in the complex routine.
